news.title: Swalwell jumps into California governor’s race, citing anti-Trump platform
news.text: Rep. Eric Swalwell, D-Calif., announced Thursday night on “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” that he is running for California governor. Swalwell said he plans to run on an anti-Trump platform."I'm excited to do it," he told Kimmel.He joins a crowded field of Democratic candidates seeking to replace term-limited Gov. Gavin Newsom. No clear front-runner has emerged in the race.RELATED STORY | Newsom says Trump climate-fighting absence is 'doubling down on stupid'Democrats in the race include former Health and Human Services Secretary Xavier Becerra, former California Assembly Majority Leader Ian Calderon, former U.S. Rep. Katie Porter, former Los Angeles Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa and former presidential candidate Tom Steyer. Former Vice President Kamala Harris was rumored to be interested in running but declined.Swalwell also ran for president in 2020 but dropped out early in the primaries to focus on winning reelection to his House seat. He last won his heavily Democratic district with more than 67% of the vote.
news.summary: Rep. Eric Swalwell, D-Calif., announced on “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” he’s running for governor, joining a crowded Democratic race to succeed Gavin Newsom.
news.author: Scripps News Group

news.title: New Jersey special election for Sherrill’s seat is set for April 16
news.text:
New Jersey Democratic Gov. Phil Murphy on Friday set the special election to complete his successor Mikie Sherrill’s unexpired House term for April 16, giving candidates a little over a week to gather signatures to appear on the primary ballot.

The primary for voters to pick party nominees in New Jersey’s 11th District is scheduled for Feb. 5. To make the primary ballot, candidates need to file by Dec. 1 – just over a week away and right after the Thanksgiving holiday – and submit 500 valid signatures. 

Sherrill, whose resignation took effect at midnight, was elected New Jersey governor earlier this month. She defeated Republican Jack Ciattarelli by 14 points. 

Several candidates have already announced campaigns for the North Jersey district, where Sherrill won a fourth term last fall by 15 points. District voters also backed Kamala Harris by 9 points, according to calculations by Inside Elections with Nathan L. Gonzales, leaving Democrats in a favored position for the special election.

Sherrill has not weighed in on the race for her successor, but Murphy has backed Essex County Commissioner Brendan Gill, his former campaign manager. New Jersey Sen. Andy Kim endorsed former Rep. Tom Malinowski, who represented the neighboring 7th District for two terms and, like Kim and Sherrill, was first elected to Congress in 2018.

Other Democrats running include Passaic County Commissioner John Bartlett; former Army paratrooper Zach Beecher; former Capitol Hill aide Marc Chaaban; former White House aide Cammie Croft; Maplewood Township Committee Person Dean Dafis; Morris Township Deputy Mayor Jeff Grayzel; Chatham Borough Council Member Justin Strickland; and political newcomer Anna Lee Williams. Lt. Gov. Tahesha Way is also expected to launch a campaign, the New Jersey Globe reported. 

Republicans on Friday pushed back on Murphy’s quick timeline. Randolph Mayor Joe Hathaway is the only GOP candidate to announce a campaign so far. 

“Governor Murphy’s special election timeline is blatant political corruption designed to protect Democratic insiders and silence voters,” Maureen O’Toole, a spokeswoman for the National Republican Congressional Committee, said in a statement. “By setting a ballot deadline to just after the Thanksgiving holiday, he’s denying access for anyone outside the political machine to qualify and give voters a real choice at the ballot box.”

Inside Elections rates the race for New Jersey’s 11th District Solid Democratic.
news.author: Posted November 21, 2025 At 12:55pm

news.title: Rachel Maddow attending Dick Cheney's funeral sparks social media frenzy
news.text: Liberal MS NOW host Rachel Maddow went viral Thursday after she was spotted at the funeral of former Vice President Dick Cheney. Maddow, who once called Cheney "the maestro of terror politics," was seen in the pews of Washington National Cathedral sitting next to Dr. Anthony Fauci. Two seats over was veteran Democratic strategist James Carville. The image of Maddow appearing at Cheney's memorial service caught many by surprise. NATIONAL CATHEDRAL HOSTS FUNERAL FOR FORMER VICE PRESIDENT DICK CHENEY "If anybody needed more evidence of how politics have changed in America: Rachel Maddow is at Dick Cheney's funeral," New York Times correspondent Peter Baker reacted on X. "Maddow's career as a commentator began during Bush/Cheney, when she'd frequently compare Cheney to the worst monsters in history (I was on her programs when she said it)," independent journalist Glenn Greenwald posted. "For so many liberals, Cheney is now rehabilitated despite regretting nothing: solely for opposing Trump." PIERS MORGAN SOUNDS OFF ON LIBERALS WELCOMING DICK CHENEY'S ENDORSEMENT OF HARRIS: ‘COMPLETELY PREPOSTEROUS’ "I got a hug from Rachel Maddow at Dick Cheney’s funeral. Cue the pigs flying," The New Yorker's Susan Glasser wrote. As she was leaving the funeral, Maddow said Cheney had changed the country "in ways that I almost 100 percent disagree with" but that she admired how he rallied behind his daughter, former Rep. Liz Cheney, R-Wy, when she took on President Donald Trump in recent years, according to a report from The Washington Post. "I think it was a really heroic stand, it’s humbling to me," Maddow said. "You know, we contain multitudes." Maddow did not immediately respond to Fox News Digital's request for comment. CLICK HERE FOR THE LATEST MEDIA AND CULTURE NEWS Cheney's funeral drew some of the biggest names in politics. Joining former President George W. Bush, who gave a eulogy honoring his running mate, were former President Joe Biden and former First Lady Jill Biden, former Vice Presidents Kamala Harris, Mike Pence and Al Gore, as well as several prominent lawmakers like Senate Majority Leader John Thune, R-S.D., former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., and Sens. Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., and Adam Schiff, D-Calif. Several members of the House Jan. 6 Committee were also in attendance in support of his daughter, who served as vice chair. Absent from the service were Trump and Vice President JD Vance, who were not invited to attend. Dick and Liz Cheney famously endorsed Harris during the 2024 presidential election. CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP
news.summary: Social media has strong reactions to liberal MS NOW host Rachel Maddow attending the funeral of former Vice President Dick Cheney, who she previously spoke critically of.
news.author: Joseph Wulfsohn

news.title: Democratic Rep. Eric Swalwell enters crowded California governor's race
news.text: Rep. Eric Swalwell announced Thursday that he will run for California governor, the latest Democrat to join the crowded race to succeed outgoing Gov. Gavin Newsom. Swalwell, who has served in Congress since 2013, will face a list of high-profile Democrats that includes former Rep. Katie Porter, former Health and Human Services Secretary Xavier Becerra, former Los Angeles Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa and activist billionaire Tom Steyer, who entered the race to lead the deep-blue state Wednesday. Swalwell announced his gubernatorial run on ABC's "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" On his new campaign website, the California Democrat focused on the need to tackle high costs and affordability as the reason he's running for statewide office. "I’m running for Governor because prices are too high and people are scared. California’s next governor has two jobs. One, keep the worst president in history out of our homes, out of our streets, and out of our lives," he said. He continued, "A lot of candidates talk about taking on Trump. I’m taking him on in real time. My January 6 lawsuit is one of the only lawsuits against the President that survived his new presidency. Speaker Pelosi selected me to help lead his impeachment, and today, I’m leading the Democrats’ effort in the House to investigate January 6." Swalwell, 45, gained prominence during President Donald Trump’s first term in office when he was heavily involved in both impeachment proceedings. That included a stint as a House manager for Trump’s second impeachment trial. He also ran for the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination, but never polled above the low single digits and ended his bid after just a few months. Swalwell has remained a fervent critic of Trump, which has made him a target of the president and his allies. In 2021, Trump and his allies claimed Swalwell had ties to a suspected Chinese spy and had been compromised by a foreign intelligence agency. Swalwell denied those claims and a House Ethics Committee probe ended in 2023 with no finding of wrongdoing. And earlier this month, a top housing official in the Trump administration referred Swalwell to the Justice Department for a potential federal criminal probe over allegations of mortgage and tax fraud. NBC News has reported that the allegations are related to a Washington, D.C., home. Swalwell is the fourth Democratic official to face mortgage fraud allegations in recent months. Swalwell has also been on the receiving end of threatening messages from people objecting to his political stance. In two cases this year, U.S. attorneys have declined to bring charges against people who threatened to kill him, a staff member in Swalwell’s office told NBC News in October. Swalwell had been widely expected to enter the California race for governor, which lacks a clear obvious front-runner. In California, candidates from all parties appear on the same primary ballot, and the top two vote-getters advance to the general election. In addition to Swalwell, Becerra, Porter, Steyer and Villaraigosa, state Superintendent of Public Instruction Tony Thurmond and former state Controller Betty Yee have also launched bids. Former Vice President Kamala Harris and Sen. Alex Padilla, D-Calif., have both said they will not run.
news.author: Adam Edelman

news.title: Unearthed FEC records expose Katie Porter's hypocrisy after she fumes at 'new billionaire' joining race
news.text: After billionaire activist Tom Steyer entered the California gubernatorial race Wednesday, former Congresswoman Katie Porter, who is also running for governor, blasted him despite previously taking thousands of dollars from him when she was in Congress. Porter said Steyer was entering the race claiming to fight "the very industries he got rich helping grow," to which the former member of Congress said: "I call bullsh--." Meanwhile, FEC filings show Porter, who is claiming to fight Steyer, received more than $16,000 between her House campaigns and failed Senate campaign. "Katie Porter is the ultimate hypocrite and all she’s done in this race is step on one rake after another," a longtime Democratic strategist, who has worked with campaigns across the country, told Fox News Digital. "This is easily the most disastrous race a Democrat has been running in 2026, which is why Porter is a real liability at the top of the ticket and why Democrats are looking around for alternatives." TOM STEYER MOUNTS CALIFORNIA GUBERNATORIAL BID, JOINING CROWD OF CANDIDATES JOCKEYING TO SUCCEED NEWSOM The Porter campaign did not respond to Fox News Digital's requests for comment on this story. Steyer, who once financed his own unsuccessful presidential bid in 2020, announced plans to enter the California gubernatorial race this week. The billionaire anti-Trump activist pledged to make life more affordable for working-class Americans and take on corporate interests in an announcement advertisement alerting people of his candidacy. Steyer specifically said he would take on the oil and tobacco industries in particular, which he touted a record of doing in the past as well. "A new billionaire in our race claims he'll fight the very industries he got rich helping grow — fossil fuel companies, tobacco, and private immigration detention facilities — at great cost to Californians," Porter posted on X after Steyer announced his run. "I call bullsh--." Attached to Porter's post was also a screenshot of a news headline from The Sacramento Bee that reads: "Tom Steyer, starring in TV ads for tobacco tax hike, invested in tobacco companies." People commenting on Porter's post highlighted her financial support she has received from Steyer in the past. Between 2018 and 2023, Porter received at least $16,100 from him, a Fox News Digital review found. CALIFORNIA PARENTS CONVICTED OF STABBING, DECAPITATING 2 CHILDREN AND FORCING OTHER KIDS TO SEE BODIES For Steyer, his wealth will likely be a target for his opponents. "Tom Steyer tried to buy the presidency — and he failed," Betty Yee, a former state controller who is running in the Democratic Primary for governor, said following Steyer's announcement. "The California governorship is not going to be his consolation prize." Porter, meanwhile, has faced criticism on the campaign trail for her attitude towards staffers and the media. She faced criticism last month after abruptly walking away from a CBS interview after lashing out at the reporter interviewing her. "What do you say to the 40% of CA voters who you'll need in order to win, who voted for Trump?" Porter was asked by CBS California's Julie Watts during a segment on the controversial redistricting effort launched by Democrats in the state. "How would I need them in order to win, ma'am?" Porter responded. DID CALIFORNIA MISMANAGE THE DEADLY PALISADES FIRE? "Well, unless you think you're going to get 60% of the vote," the reporter, asking about the voter breakdown of Democrats and Republicans in the state, said before Porter started laughing. Porter then went back and forth with the reporter, arguing about whether she needs to court and win over Trump voters, particularly if she's running head-to-head against another Democrat. "So you don't need them to win," Watts asked Porter. "I feel like this is unnecessarily argumentative," Porter said, prompting the reporter to point out that she had asked the same question to the other candidates in the race and they answered it. "I don't want to keep doing this, I'm going to call it," Porter said. When Watts reminded Porter that every candidate had answered the question, Porter said, "I don't care." CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD THE FOX NEWS APP Meanwhile, Porter has also faced repeated criticism about how she allegedly treats staffers. In just a span of a single week, three videos went viral of Porter berating her staff. The race for California governor is a crowded one, with big names like former Los Angeles Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa and former U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Xavier Becerra. Former Vice President Kamala Harris was reportedly planning on getting involved but ultimately backed away. Lesser known candidates include state schools Superintendent Tony Thurmond, former Controller Betty Yee and former Assemblyman Ian Calderon.
news.summary: Katie Porter’s jab at billionaire Tom Steyer after he entered California's gubernatorial race backfired after records showed she took more than $10k from him.
news.author: Alec Schemmel,Cameron Cawthorne

news.title: Gary Bauer: They're Back!
news.text:
Former President George W. Bush emerged from his self-imposed political “exile” yesterday to deliver a eulogy at the funeral of his vice president, Dick Cheney. And it may not be the last that we see of Mr. Bush.

There are reports that members of the Bush family and other GOP establishment hacks are putting together a serious effort to “retake” the Republican Party when Donald Trump’s administration ends. You would have thought they had learned their lesson after Jeb! crashed and burned in the 2016 primaries.

They want to take the GOP back to what it has always been: The party that can’t find a war it doesn’t want to fight, that wants to cut your mother’s Social Security checks, that wants mass migration into the country, that bows before the Chamber of Commerce, and kowtows to communist China in the name of “free trade.”

Former RNC Chairman Michael Steele is reportedly part of this group. That’s telling. Steele is essentially a Democrat now. He’s a commentator on MSDNC. He worked with Never Trumpers to defeat Republicans in 2020. He voted for Kamala Harris.

And he’s going to remake the GOP? Give me a break!

There are also reports that Steele and other disgruntled “Republicans” are angry that George W. Bush has not spoken out publicly against “the scourge of Trumpism.”

Well, guess what? The conservative base of the GOP is mad at Bush for not uttering one word of support for Donald Trump.

Not when the FBI raided his house and rummaged through his wife’s underwear.

Not when partisan prosecutors tried to throw him in jail on trumped-up charges.

Not when Joe Biden or others smeared Trump and MAGA supporters as “fascists.”

Not when partisan Democrats tried to kick Trump off the ballot.

Not when radical Democrats called on members of the military to disobey orders of the commander-in-chief.

Nothing has moved George W. Bush to speak one word of support for the most popular and successful Republican president in modern times.

Kamala’s Revenge?

This item is really important. Read it, read it again, and save it.

Kamala Harris spoke at an event Wednesday hosted by haters in the Never Trump movement and was asked about the Epstein files. She accused President Trump of “gaslighting the American people,” and then shouted, “Release the files!” The left-wing crowd roared in approval.

Does anyone remember what Harris’s job was nine months ago? She was the vice president of the United States for four years.

Joe Biden and Kamala Harris had total control of the Epstein files. They never talked about them. They never tried to release them. They were totally uninterested in them. But now, Harris is screaming for them to be released.

Isn’t that odd?

Why did the Democrats—Biden, Harris, Schumer, and Jeffries—say nothing and do nothing about the Epstein files during the last four years? It’s logical to assume there was something in them that they didn’t want the public to see. But now, they are over-the-top in demanding they be released. Why?

If there was anything that implicated Donald Trump in those files, I have no doubt they would have released them when they had the chance and when they were trying to destroy Donald Trump. But they didn’t, and it is logical to assume there wasn’t anything they could use against Trump in those files.

Consider this: We know that the CIA, the NSA, and other intelligence agencies are skilled in spreading lies and misinformation to hurt America’s foreign enemies. They are experts at doing this. It is all part of the propaganda war.

But in the last decade, we have seen them use those skills of deception to hurt conservatives in the United States. Under Biden/Harris, these agencies had plenty of time to doctor the Epstein files to incriminate Trump.

If that sounds outlandish, think again.

It’s exactly what Hillary Clinton and the Deep State did to Donald Trump the first time he won. They “doctored” intelligence about Russian collusion after Hillary’s unexpected defeat in 2016. And Joe Biden was in on it from the very beginning! (Here, here, and here.)

National Amnesia

Do we have amnesia about what the last four years were like? Here’s a brief reminder: 

Fifteen million people walked into our country, and we had virtually no idea who they were. In a matter of weeks, Donald Trump brought illegal border crossings down to virtually zero. 

The inflation rate during the Biden/Harris years hit 9%. Trump has it down to 3%, and wages are growing faster than that. Biden’s Inflation Reduction Act had nothing to do with reducing inflation. In fact, it made inflation worse! Americans lost $3,000 in wages under Biden. This year, under Donald Trump, American workers will see $1,000 in wage increases. 

Gas hit $5.00 a gallon under Biden. It’s roughly $3.00 now—down forty percent. 

Egg prices under Biden peaked at nearly $5.00 a dozen. Now, they’re down to roughly $2.00. 

The cost of a Thanksgiving dinner hit a record high under Biden at $64. This year, it’s down to $55. 

The 15 million people Biden let into the country weren’t all living in New York City hotels. Many were living in apartments, driving up rent prices. As they started earning some money, they bought starter houses, driving up housing prices and pricing young Americans out of the market. 

Higher interest rates, driven by Biden’s obscene spending, and higher housing prices, driven by Biden’s open borders, have resulted in native-born or naturalized U.S. citizens being unable to afford the American Dream. 

Our military was demoralized under Biden and couldn’t meet recruiting quotas. Under Donald Trump, so many young men and women rushed to enlist that the military met its yearly recruitment quotas in months. 

Under Biden, foreign countries were dumping their products into our country and keeping our goods out of theirs. Donald Trump stopped that. 

The inflation/affordability issue shows the power of the fake news media. When inflation exploded under Biden, he famously blamed Vladimir Putin. It worked. Polling found that the public blamed Putin more than they blamed Biden, at least initially. Eventually, Biden got the blame.

But if recent polls are accurate, in just nine months the public has gone from blaming Biden to blaming Trump for the “affordability crisis” Biden and Harris caused.

If that results in voters giving the House and Senate back to the Democrats a year from now, it will effectively end Trump’s presidency. We will deserve whatever happens to us. It will be like committing national suicide.

Job growth in September, going into the government shutdown, was much stronger than anticipated. (The Schumer Shutdown is why we’re just now getting the September numbers.) Economists expected 50,000 new jobs would be created that month. Instead, 119,000 new jobs were created.

The 119,000 figure is particularly impressive at a time when AI technology is resulting in significant layoffs.

Now, because the economy was growing, more people entered the workforce looking for jobs. So, the unemployment rate ticked up slightly from 4.3% to 4.4%. How does the unemployment rate go up when job growth is up? More than 119,000 people realized the economy was growing and decided to look for a job.

A White House report notes that one major trend of the last four years under Biden has reversed: All job gains are now going to native-born Americans. “Over the past year, more than 2.5 million native-born Americans gained employment, while 670,000 foreign-born workers lost employment.”

Let me be precise about what that means: 670,000 previously employed illegal aliens have either self-deported or been removed from the country under President Trump, opening up jobs for American citizens.

Even the fake news media couldn’t deny the good news. Here are some reactions to the jobs report:

“Hiring Defied Expectations in September, With 119,000 New Jobs” – The Wall Street Journal

“Jobs report blows past expectations, defying hiring slowdown” – ABC News

“Employers added 119,000 jobs in September, blowing past expectations” – CBS News

“Delayed September report shows U.S. added 119,000 jobs, more than expected” –CNBC

The Battle For America

I’ve written before about a group called “By Any Means Necessary” (BAMN). It’s a far-left group of Marxist revolutionaries, and the name tells you everything you need to know. BAMN’s latest crusade is attacking Turning Point USA chapters on college and high school campuses.

And I mean literally attacking them. Think about that.

What does Turning Point USA’s name stand for? It means the country has reached a turning point, a change of direction back to the values of Faith, Family, and Freedom. Back to reliable standards of right and wrong, renewed patriotism, and understanding that our liberty comes from God.

And what is the Left’s reaction? Some leftists so hate those values, they will do anything to stop them—by any means necessary. Well, as we saw on September 10th, those same forces killed Charlie Kirk.

Violence, and even murder, is how real fascists, real Nazis, and real Marxists win arguments.

Not So Special

Former Special Counsel Jack Smith has repeatedly proven that there is nothing “special” about him other than his eagerness to persecute conservatives. Like the Deep State, Smith grossly abused his power in his jihad against Donald Trump, which went beyond Trump.

Smith attempted to collect information on the phone records of multiple Republican members of Congress in an effort to take down the entire Republican Party. Sadly, the phone companies cooperated with him, just like Big Tech cooperated with the Biden administration to censor opinions online.

As soon as the GOP took over the House of Representatives after the 2022 election, Smith demanded the phone records of then-Speaker Kevin McCarthy. AT&T originally said it refused to provide the information. But AT&T has now conceded that it did in fact surrender McCarthy’s phone records.

Every media outlet, except for Fox News, is ignoring these serious allegations. They are engaging in self-censorship to serve the interests of the Deep State, which has been abusing the power of the federal government to target conservatives, Christians, pro-life activists, and parents.

There is more work to do to rein in the Deep State!

Distorting The Gospel

Christians must be in the public square, offering biblical insight on issues including parental rights, racial reconciliation, economic justice, and ending corruption. But what if some Christian leaders who do get involved throw the Bible away and instead side with some of the most radical forces in America?

Read more in my latest public policy update for the James Dobson Family Institute.

news.title: Why didn't Barack and Michelle Obama attend Dick Cheney's funeral? Here's the reason
news.text:
APWhy didn't Barack and Michelle Obama attend Dick Cheney's funeral? Here's the reason

Barack and Michelle Obama are once again making headlines for their absence from a major political event. This time, the former first couple did not attend Dick Cheney’s funeral, marking Michelle’s latest step away from long-standing political norms. Their decision comes during a year when Michelle has been visibly selective about public appearances, as per a report by People.Their absence adds them to a growing list of prominent figures who are choosing, or in some cases are expected, to skip the service.ALSO READ: Co-Founder fires employees over affair; the move sparks integrity debate in the workplaceDick Cheney, who served as vice president under George W. Bush and remained one of the most influential Republican figures of his generation, died on Nov. 3 at age 84. While former presidents and first ladies typically attend the funerals of former vice presidents, the expectations around this tradition aren’t always strict. A source familiar with the situation confirmed that Barack and Michelle Obama are not expected to attend, as per a report by People.Why are the Obamas missing major political events?Live EventsThe reason behind their absence hasn’t been made public. However, this isn’t the first time the Obamas have stepped away from an event that other past presidents and first ladies attended. They also missed the funeral of Democratic Vice President Walter Mondale in 2022, suggesting that absence from such services isn’t unprecedented for them.ALSO READ: What does 67 mean, who made the 67 meme and why is it so popular?Earlier this year, Michelle missed two major events that typically draw attendance from former first couples: the funeral of former President Jimmy Carter and Donald Trump’s second inauguration. Barack attended both events alone. Throughout the year, Michelle has been vocal about keeping distance from political obligations and prioritizing personal choice over tradition. She has described this shift as practicing the “art of saying no,” a message she has repeated publicly while discussing her decisions, as per a report by People.Who else skipped Cheney’s funeral?While the Obamas’ absence is notable, they are hardly alone. President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance were reportedly not invited to Cheney’s funeral, according to Axios. That detail represents a more striking break from typical protocol, but is less surprising given Cheney’s decision to break party lines and endorse the Democratic presidential ticket in 2024, as per a report by People.ALSO READ: New poll delivers big blow to Trump as approval rating takes sharp diveCheney was accorded complete military honors during the exclusive memorial service in Washington's National Cathedral. Former Presidents Joe Biden and George W. Bush, along with former First Ladies Jill Biden and Laura Bush, were there, as were former Vice Presidents Kamala Harris, Mike Pence, Al Gore, and Dan Quayle, as quoted in a report by CNN. The memorial service was also attended by several Supreme Court Justices, including Chief Justice John Roberts, Justice Brett Kavanaugh, and Justice Elena Kagan. A significant contingent of former and current Cabinet ministers from both Republican and Democratic administrations, together with congressional leaders from both parties, were anticipated. Speaker Emerita Nancy Pelosi attended alongside Senate Majority Leader John Thune and former leader Mitch McConnell, as per a report by CNN.On Nov. 5, following the announcement of Cheney’s death, Barack Obama shared a message honoring Cheney’s public service. He wrote, “Although Dick Cheney and I represented very different political traditions, I respected his life-long devotion to public service and his deep love of country. Michelle and I extend our deepest condolences to his family," as per a report by People.How does this absence fit into Michelle Obama’s shift away from protocol?Michelle’s absences throughout the year have drawn attention, particularly her decision not to attend Carter’s funeral in January. Carter died on Dec. 29, 2024, at age 100. Michelle’s spokesperson at the time said she was still on vacation in Hawaii and cited a scheduling conflict. “Former First Lady Michelle Obama is not in attendance at President Carter’s National Funeral Service,” her spokesperson shared. “Mrs. Obama sends her thoughts and prayers to the Carter family, and everyone who loved and learned from the remarkable former President.”Her absence stood out, as all five living presidents and all other first ladies attended—Bill and Hillary Clinton, George and Laura Bush, Donald and Melania Trump, and Joe and Jill Biden. Barack arrived alone, and Michelle would have been seated near Trump, who has a long history of making disparaging comments about the Obama family, as per a report by People.ALSO READ: Trump got a priceless gold clock from the Rolex CEO, and then he cut Switzerland's tariffs to 15%Less than a week later, her spokesperson confirmed that Michelle would also not attend Trump’s second inauguration. A source close to her told PEOPLE that following protocol simply wasn’t enough reason for her to appear. "There's no overstating her feelings about [Trump]. She's not one to plaster on a pleasant face and pretend for protocol's sake,” the source said. “Michelle doesn't do anything because it's expected or it's protocol or it's tradition.”Michelle later addressed both absences on her IMO podcast. She said, “It took everything in my power to not do the thing that was perceived as right, but do the things that was right for me, that was a hard thing for me to do.” She added that making choices aligned with her personal boundaries is part of what she described as practicing the “art of saying no.”“It’s a muscle that you have to build,” she explained in April. “And I think we suffered, because it's almost like we started training late in life to build that muscle, right? I am just now starting to build it.”As the Obamas sit out Cheney’s funeral, their decision adds another reminder that Michelle, in particular, is redefining what post-White House life looks like for a former first lady—one choice, and one “no,” at a time.FAQsWhy did the Obamas not attend Dick Cheney’s funeral?No clear reason has been given, though it follows Michelle’s trend of stepping back from traditional political expectations.Who else wasn’t at the Dick Cheney funeral?Donald Trump, JD Vance and Bill Clinton are also not expected to attend.Add as a Reliable and Trusted News Source Add Now!

news.summary: Barack and Michelle Obama will not attend Dick Cheney's funeral, with Michelle previously missing other prominent political events this year. She has spoken about practicing the "art of saying no" and prioritizing her own decisions over perceived obligations. While Barack honored Cheney's service publicly, the Obamas' absence from the funeral is noted.
